attributes.action: Reconsider tuition fees of students at University.
attributes.additional_details: Due to COVID-19, most students are attending online lectures, or have most of their lectures online. Due to this, we are not using University resources like normal, apart from their e-library. This should not cost students more than £9250 a year. Furthermore, many universities have issues with online learning, and libraries are yet to resolve licensing issues with much needed e-books. Due to our current financial situation, we would also like to be given a refund via our banks.
attributes.background: To re-evaluate the tuition fee for ALL students, UK/EU as well as international students, and give students a refund via bank transfer to help them with their current financial situations as well as the inconvenience, rather than decreasing the loan with the student loans companies.

rejection.details:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552911

You may also wish to sign some of these petitions which call for related actions: 

Reimburse all students of this year’s fees due to strikes and COVID-19:  
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302855 

Require universities to reimburse students' tuition fees during strike action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300528 

Refund university rent and tuition fees due to coronavirus: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/304855 

Refund university students for 3rd Semester Tuition 2020: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/306494 

We understand that the current situation is stressful for many people, including students. Student Minds, a mental health charity for students, is collating guidance and developing resources to support students experiencing stress as a result of the current situation, which you may find useful: https://www.studentminds.org.uk/coronavirus.html
